artist: Artist: Marcel Duchamp; Artist: Richard Hamilton; Artist: Ecke Bonk; Publisher: Edition Hansjörg Mayer, Stuttgart, London, Reykjavik
description: gray slipcase containing two hard cover books and a paper leaflet; one book is green with the title 'THE BRIDE STRIPPED BARE BY HER BACHELORS EVEN' spelled across cover using small black and white dots; 'MARCEL DUCHAMP' spelled across spine of book in same type of letters; second book has a black spine with 'Marcel Duchamp' signed in green cursive letters; cover is cream with a large letter 'D' with an image of a wheel in a cube inside letter; paper leaflet is blue containing text; bound volumes (3); lender's archive #225
image_copyright: © Marcel Duchamp and Richard Hamilton %2F Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York %2F DACS%2C UK
markings:
Bride: Numbered in pencil on copyright page: 238/300
Infinitive: Numbered in pencil on colophon page: 238/300
Notes: Numbered in pencil on signature page: 238
provenance: William P. Kosmas, London, England (d. 2017); Estate of William P. Kosmas, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
signed: Signed in pencil on signature page of \"Notes et/and Notations\": R Hamilton │ Ecke Bonk
title: The Bride Stripped Bare by Her Bachelors, Even / In the Infinitive / Notes et/and Notations
